title: 107_hr1309
content: MODIFICATIONS TO ENCOURAGE CONTRIBUTIONS OF CAPITAL GAIN REAL PROPERTY FOR CONSERVATION PURPOSES AND QUALIFIED CONSERVATION CONTRIBUTIONS. Contributions of Capital Gain Real Property and Qualified Conservation Contributions are modified to encourage conservation purposes. Clause (iv) is added to section 170(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code, exempting qualified conservation contributions from special limitations on contributions of capital gain property. Contributions of capital gain real property for conservation purposes are exempt from special limitations under section 170(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code. The donor must contribute their entire interest in the property to a qualified organization organized for conservation purposes, as defined in section 170(h)(3) and (4)(A), and receive a letter of intent from the organization. Contributions of capital gain real property for conservation purposes are not subject to the 5-year limitation for carryover contributions under section 170(d) of the Internal Revenue Code. The amendment made by this section applies to contributions of capital gain real property for conservation purposes, with an effective date for taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. Modification of rules for estate tax exclusion for land under qualified conservation easement. Repeal of restrictions on land location and exclusion limitations under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for qualified conservation easements. Amendments include changes to the location requirements and the exclusion calculation method. Amendments are made to sections 2031(c) and 2032(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the determination of land and easement values for qualified conservation easements. The changes involve redesignating paragraphs and amending specific references within the code. The amendment involves defining a qualified conservation easement as a contribution of real property with restrictions on commercial use. The amendment defines a qualified conservation easement as a contribution of real property with restrictions on commercial recreational activities, with special rules for retained rights in the easement. The amendment restricts commercial recreational activities on donated real property, with provisions for retained rights in the easement. The amendment restricts commercial recreational activities on donated real property, with provisions for retained rights in the easement. The amendments made by this section apply to estates of decedents dying after the date of the enactment of this Act.
